alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Chester; Spartanburg; Union; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:28AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chester, southern York, southeastern Spartanburg, southeastern Cherokee and Union Counties through 1100 AM EDT... At 1028 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Lincolnton to 10 miles northwest of Laurens. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Union, York, Chester, Lesslie, Great Falls, Monarch Mill, Buffalo, Jonesville and Fort Lawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
